channel.title: Authors on Global freshwater biodiversity research
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on Global freshwater biodiversity research

item.title: People
item.description:
Dr. Sami Domisch is a Leibniz Junior Research Group Leader and is interested in freshwater biodiversity and biogeography across spatial scales, and in developing tools in spatial freshwater biodiversity science.

Dr. Jaime Garcia Marquez is a GIS Data Analyst with a strong emphasis in open-source methods & tools for analysing large biodiversity data sets using the Linux command-line and the High Performance Computing cluster.

Dr. Jens Kiesel is a hydrologic modeller with a long experience in the fields of hydrology, hydraulics, erosion and sediment transport as well as habitat modelling on various scales and ecoregions.

Dr. Yusdiel Torres Cambas is an Alexander von Humboldt Postdoc. He is working on spatial conservation planning across Cuba considering freshwater biodiversity and ecosystem services under present-day conditions and global change scenarios.

Afroditi Grigoropoulou is a PhD student focusing on global aquatic insect biodiversity, with an emphasis on patterns of aquatic insect diversity across multiple spatial scales.

Maria Üblacker is a PhD student working on a high-resolution freshwater habitat characterization across spatial scales, to highlight patterns and potential gaps in the global network of protected areas.

Annika Brunner is a master Student at Freie Universität Berlin and writes her master thesis at IGB. Annika integrates Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSPs) into freshwater biodiversity projections.

Thomas Tomiczek is a master student from the Humboldt University working on his master thesis at the IGB. His thesis addresses integrating freshwater biodiversity in large scale conservation planning in Colombia.

Visitors

Mathieu Floury is a visiting Postdoc from the Ecology of Natural and Anthropized Hydrosystems Lab (LEHNA). He is interested in ecology and conservation of biodiversity in hydrosystems across spatial and temporal scales.

Xiling Deng is a visiting PhD student from the Senckenberg Research Institute and Natural History Museum. She is working on the phylogeography of caddiesflies along elevational gradients.

Francesco Polazzo is a visiting PhD student from the IMDEA Water Institute of Alcalá de Henares, Madrid. He studies how climate change and others drivers of environmental change affect the stability and vulnerability of aquatic communities.

Previous members

Dr. Longzhu Shen is a postdoc with a strong mathematical background, focusing on machine learning and GIS methods to optimize predictions of discharge and nutrients in stream networks.

Lydia Nass is a master student from the Freie Universität Berlin. She is doing an intership at the IGB, focusing on open-source geocomputational and species distribution modelling methods.

Martin Friedrichs-Manthay is a PhD student working on fish distribution models, assessing scale-dependencies and model uncertainties for conservation (funded by the GLANCE project and co-supervised by Sami).

Collaborators

  • Giuseppe Amatulli
  • Jens Kiesel
  • Longzhu Shen
  • Jani Heino
  • Walter Jetz
  • Virgilio Hermoso
  • Mathias Kuemmerlen
  • Simone Langhans
  • Rita Adrian
  • Sonja Jähnig
  • Peter Haase
  • Daniel Hering
  • Eren Turak
  • Francisco Valente Neto
  • Leandro Juen
  • Ana Paula Justino de Faria
  • Karina Dias Silva
  • Russell Death
  • Anna Astorga
  • Jonathan Tonkin
  • Fabio de Oliveira Roque Roque
  • Ram Devi Tachamo Shah
  • Deep Narayan Shah
  • Renato Tavares Martins
  • Francis Arimoro
  • Emmanuel Akindele
  • John Simaika
  • Florian Altermatt
  • Richard Johnson

Sami Domisch is a Leibniz Junior Research Group Leader at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Sami is interested in freshwater biodiversity with an emphasis on spatial biodiversity patterns, macroecology, and developing tools to assess freshwater biodiversity across large spatial scales.

The group uses a wide array of open-source tools for spatial biodiversity informatics such as R, GRASS, GDAL/OGR, pktools, OpenForis within the Linux environment.

Career
  • since 2019 - Leibniz Junior Research Group Leader at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • 2016-2019 - Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (Postdoc)
  • 2013-2016 - Yale University, USA (Postdoctoral associate and DFG postdoctoral fellow)
  • 2012-2013 - Biodiversity and Climate Research Centre (BiK-F), Frankfurt, Germany (Postdoc)
Funding and awards
  • Alexander von Humboldt Foundation: Co-host for Dr. Torres-Cambas’ grant “Protecting the future of freshwater biodiversity and ecosystem services across Cuba”
  • Leibniz Association and IGB: Leibniz Junior Research Group “Global freshwater biodiversity, biogeography and conservation (GLOWABIO)” (J45/2018), started in 2019
  • German Research Foundation (DFG): Co-PI for grant ‘Himalopsyche/QTP Region’ (DO 1880_3-2)
  • Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF): Co-authored the proposal for grant ‘WANDEL’ (GROW-937-3583-018; Co-PIs: S. Jähnig, M. Pusch)
  • German Research Foundation (DFG): 2-year Postdoctoral fellowship at Yale University, USA (DO 1880_1-1)
  • EFFS-Award, subsidiary price for the best European PhD dissertation in freshwater science 2011-2012
Reviewer activities
  • Member of Editorial Advisory Board: Limnologica, Global Change Biology (2014-2017)
  • Funding agencies: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC), German Centre for Integrative Biodiversity Research (iDiv), GO-IN-Goethe International Post-Doc Programme (Goethe Universität Frankfurt, Germany)
  • Journal referee: Aquatic Sciences, Biological Conservation, Biology Letters, Biological Invasions, Diversity & Distributions, Ecography, Ecological Applications, Ecological Engineering, Ecological Indicators, Ecological Modelling, Freshwater Biology, Freshwater Science, Fundamental and Applied Limnology (Guest Editor), Global Change Biology (Advisory Board member 2013-2017), Global Ecology and Conservation, Hydrobiologia, Integrative Zoology, Journal of Applied Ecology, Journal of Biogeography, Journal of Environmental Management, Knowledge and Management of Aquatic Ecosystems, Limnetica, Limnologica, Marine Ecology Progress Series, Methods in Ecology & Evolution, Scientific Data, Scientific Reports, PLoS ONE, The Science of Nature, WIREs Climate Change

Afroditi Grigoropoulou is a PhD student at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). She is working on global patterns of freshwater macroinvertebrate diversity across multiple spatial scales.

Career
  • since 2020 - PhD student at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • 2018-2019 - Department of Evolutionary Biology, Ecology and Environmental Science, University of Barcelona (MSc)
  • 2013-2017 - Faculty of Biology, University of Athens (BSc)

Annika Brunner is a master student at Freie Universität Berlin and writes her master thesis at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Annika is integrating Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSPs) into freshwater biodiversity projections in South America.

Francesco Polazzo is PhD student in the Ecotoxicology group at the IMDEA Water Institute of Alcalá de Henares, Madrid. Francesco is part of the ITN project ECORISk2050. Within this project, he is studying how climate change in combination with others drivers of environmental change (pesticides, eutrophication, changes in hydrology) affect the stability and the vulnerability of aquatic communities.

Career
  • since 2019 - PhD student at the IMDEA Water Institute (Alcalá de Henares, Madrid, Spain)
  • 2018-2019 - Internship at the faculty of Ecology of the University of Innsbruck (Austria)
  • 2015-2018 - MSc in Global change ecology, Faculty of life science, University of Trieste (Italy)
  • 2012-2015 - BSc in Biology, Faculty of life science, University of Trieste (Italy)

Jaime Garcia Marquez is a GIS and Data Analyst at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Jaime has a long expertise on the use of ecological spatial methods which he has applied in research and consulting on biodiversity and ecosystem services conservation and landscape planning.

Career
  • since 2019 - GIS and Data Analyst at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • 2018-2019 - Geography Department, Humboldt Universität zu Berlin (Postdoc)
  • 2014-2018 - Integrative Research Institute on Transformations of Human-Environment Systems (IRI THESys), Humboldt Universität zu Berlin (Postdoc)
  • 2011-2013 - Environmental Consultant
  • 2010-2011 - Biodiversity and Climate Research Centre (BiK-F), Frankfurt, Germany (Postdoc)
Reviewer activities
  • Journal referee: International Journal of Geographical Information Systems, Ecological Modelling, Plant Ecology and Diversity, International Journal of Biodiversity Science, Ecosystem Services & Management, Land Use Policy

Jens Kiesel is a Hydrologist at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Jens has a long expertise on environmental modelling which he has applied in research and international consulting. His modelling experience includes hydrology, hydraulics, erosion and sediment transport as well as habitat modelling on various scales and ecoregions.

Career
  • since 2014 - Research Scientist (part time) at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • since 2009 - Freelance Consultant
  • 2012-2014 - Research Associate at the Department of Hydrology and Water Resources Management, Kiel University
Reviewer activities
  • Journal referee: Advances in Geosciences, Hydrological Processes, Hydrological Sciences Journal, Ecohydrology and Hydrobiology, Ecological Indicators, Agricultural Water Management, Water, River Research and Applications, Computers and Geosciences, Journal of Hydrology, Hydrology and Earth System Sciences, Environmental Modelling and Software, International Journal of River Basin Management, PeerJ, Frontiers

Dr. Longzhu Shen is a GIS modeller at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Dr. Shen’s technical background was quantum chemistry with broad applications, especially in areas related to ecology, environment and public health. After Ph.D. training, he migrated further into machine learning oriented modellings and often crafted unique solutions via coupling the physical principles and data-driven approaches. He has built predictive models to estimate the distributions of nitrogen and phosphorus in their various forms in the streams around the globe.

Career
  • since Oct. 2020 - GIS modeller at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • 2019-2020 - Independent modelling consultant
  • 2017-2019 - Department of Zoology, University of Cambridge, UK (Postdoc)
  • 2014-2018 - School of the Environment, Yale University, USA (Postdoc)
Reviewer activities
  • Journal referee: Global Biogeochemical Cycles, Science of the Total Environment, Resources, Conservation & Recycling, Journal of Agriculture and Food Chemistry Chemosphere, International Journal Polymer Science, Journal of Coordination Chemistry

Lydia Nass is a Master student at the Free University of Berlin working as an intern at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). Her work addresses the biodiversity in freshwaters across europe.

Career
  • 2019-2020 - Erasmus year at the University of Bordeaux in the Master program Marine Environment and Resources
  • 2017 - Internship at the national park Jasmund
  • 2016 - Intrernship at K&S Umweltgutachten

Marlene Üblacker is a PhD student at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). She is working on a high-resolution freshwater habitat characterization and is conducting analyses across spatial scales to highlight distinct patterns of aquatic insects and potential gaps in the global network of protected areas.

Mathieu Floury is a Freshwater Ecologist at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB) and the Ecology of Natural and Anthropized Hydrosystems Lab (LEHNA) interested in ecology and conservation of biodiversity in hydrosystems. A large part of his work is dedicated to understanding and predicting freshwater community responses to environmental drivers at different spatial and temporal scales, in order to better inform and guide conservation actions in river networks.

Career
  • 2021 - Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (Postdoc)
  • 2020-2022 - Ecology of Natural and Anthropized Hydrosystems Lab, CNRS - University Claude Bernard, Lyon, France (Postdoc)
  • 2014-2019 - Quantitative Hydroecology Lab, IRSTEA, Lyon, France (Postdoc)
  • 2013 - Microorganisms: Genome and Environment Lab, CNRS - University Blaise Pascal, Clermont-Ferrand, France (Postdoc)

Thomas Tomiczek is a Master student from the Humboldt University working on his Master thesis at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB). His thesis addresses integrating freshwater biodiversity in large scale conservation planning in Colombia.

Career
  • since 2020 - Master thesis at Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries
  • 2018-2018 - WWF - World Wide Fund For Nature, Berlin (Internship)
  • 2015-2015 - Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and Environment, The Hague, Netherlands (Internship)
  • 2013-2013 - Bachelor thesis at Helmholtz Institute, Centre for Environmental Research, Leipzig, Germany

Yusdiel Torres Cambas is a postdoc at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB) and at the Institute of Geoecology, TU Braunschweig. He is working to assess the protection offered by the Cuban protected area system to freshwater biodiversity and to the supply of freshwater ecosystem services, considering the present conditions and future climate and land use/land cover change scenarios.

Career
  • since 2021 - Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries and Institute of Geoecology, TU Braunschweig (Postdoc)
  • 2006-2020 - Department of Biology, Universidad de Oriente (Lecturer)
Reviewer activities
  • Journal referee: Scientific Data, Journal of Ecology and the Natural Environment, Revista de Biología Tropical, Revista de Investigaciones Marinas
